bf1e000a7f68076e2921ac4f020e5f8c24330e84.commitMessage:
Provide test instance to container level extensions

Issue: #419

7205f05c4a314a808b1a558d1e3044ec9bccc21a.commitMessage:
Allow @BeforeAll and @AfterAll methods to be non-static

Issue: #419

62c433c14ce9d70fa5b82ef385a6e15c22cc0003.commitMessage:
Ensure AfterAlls are invoked if exception is thrown by a BeforeAll

- BeforeAll: @BeforeAll method or BeforeAllCallback
- AfterAll:  @AfterAll method or AfterAllCallback

Prior to this commit, if an exception was thrown by a BeforeAll, then
AfterAlls were never invoked, which is in strict contrast to the
semantics of JUnit 4 and other frameworks.

This commit fixes this problem by ensuring that AfterAlls (for the
appropriate nesting level) are invoked even if a BeforeAll throws an
exception.

Fixes: #359

Rename all JUnit 5 artifacts to platform, jupiter, & vintage

507e50872c6df8a66c32f45cb2153555f510c4b1.commitMessage: Rename base package of junit5-api and junit5-engine to org.junit.jupiter

9eacc9c2d51557bffa003ca24fa125b8cbe69bbb.commitMessage:
Convert MethodInvoker to generic ExecutableInvoker

Prior to this commit, MethodInvoker was limited to method invocations.
With the recent generalization of the ParameterResolver API, it is now
possible to convert MethodInvoker to a generic ExecutableInvoker that
can be applied to constructors or methods, serving as a building block
for possible constructor injection support.

This commit converts MethodInvoker to a generic ExecutableInvoker that
can be used to invoke both methods and constructors with dynamic
parameter resolution via registered ParameterResolvers.

Specifically, this commit includes the following changes.

 - Renamed MethodInvoker to ExecutableInvoker
 - Refactored ExecutableInvoker to support parameter resolution for any
   java.lang.reflect.Executable
 - Introduced newInstance(Constructor<T>, Object...) in ReflectionUtils
 - Introduced invoke(Constructor), invoke(Method), and
   invoke(Method, Object) in ExecutableInvoker
 - Removed MethodInvocationContext and MethodInvocationContextFactory
 - Removed ConstructorInvoker proof of concept

Issue: #267

6b575f2ee5f02288a774ff0a85ce3a3e3cb6946f.commitMessage:
Eagerly load and validate @BeforeEach & @AfterEach methods

With this commit @BeforeEach and @AfterEach methods are looked up and
validated eagerly during the discovery phase instead of late in the game
during the execution phase.

This commit also extracts a new LifecycleMethodUtils class from the
ClassTestDescriptor.

Issue: #232

b691e6a02b9436939bf1867156aa8d8cea4e3fbf.commitMessage:
Do not synthesize @BeforeAll & @AfterAll methods as extensions

This commit avoids unnecessary streaming and synthesizing of extensions
as lambda expressions for @BeforeAll and @AfterAll methods. Instead,
@BeforeAll and @AfterAll methods are now invoked directly using
standard for-loops.

Issue: #232

b2ba6b95138382f25ca757a5ca2a7295bee4c3b8.commitMessage:
Do not mix execution of extensions and user code

This commit separates the execution of extensions and user code with
regard to test lifecycle callbacks.

Issue: #232
